nodes.title: Article S11
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the organizational structure and operating rules for a multi-tiered national youth council system. It covers the composition of the General Assembly at four levels (National, Provincial, Urban/District, and Local), detailing their elected members and delegates. It defines the General Assembly as the supreme body with specific powers, including adopting action plans, voting on budgets, and electing the executive bureau. The document also specifies rules for convening meetings, quorum requirements, and mandatory government oversight. Finally, it describes the composition and administrative support structure of the executive bureau.

nodes.title: Article S12
nodes.summary:
This partial document covers sections from a legal or regulatory text (likely statutes or internal regulations for a "Conseil national de la jeunesse" or similar youth council). The main points are:
1. **State Subsidies**: The council can receive state subsidies for its operation and objectives.
2. **Control Mechanisms**: Articles detail requirements for submitting statutes, internal regulations, and their modifications to the relevant ministry for approval; presenting accounting records to the ministry upon request; and submitting annual reports and financial accounts for monitoring and control.
3. **Sanctions and Disciplinary Measures**: Provisions for sanctions and disciplinary measures are outlined in the council's statutes and internal regulations.

nodes.title: Article S14
nodes.summary:
This partial document covers the eligibility criteria and election procedures for the Bureau of a Youth Council.

Specifically, it details the conditions for candidacy (including citizenship, moral character, and prior experience), the process for submitting candidatures at various levels, the examination and registration of applications, the democratic election mechanisms, the four-year renewable term of office, and the official installation of the elected Bureau by the relevant ministry or authority.

nodes.title: Article S3
nodes.summary:
###### Article S3

DE LA CONSTITUTION DU CONSEIL NATIONAL

nodes.title: Article S4
nodes.summary:
This partial document is a legal article establishing a national youth council structure in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The main points covered are:

1.  The creation of a "National Youth Council" (C.N.J.) as a consultative and coordinating body, emanating from provincial councils.
2.  The specific objectives of this National Youth Council, including representing youth associations to the government, sharing experiences, promoting patriotism and solidarity, coordinating youth protection and education efforts, fostering international relations, and representing Congolese youth at international institutions.
3.  The establishment of a hierarchical structure of youth councils at different administrative levels: Provincial Youth Councils, District Councils, Urban Councils, and Local Youth Councils in basic administrative entities (cities, territories, communes). Each council is defined as an emanation of the councils or associations at the lower level.
